questions.question: 1. The isoelectric point of an amino acid is defined as

answers.a: pH where amino acids carboxyl group is uncharged
answers.c: pH where amino acids amino group is uncharged
answers.d: pH where amino acid has a net charge of zero

questions.question: 2. Which of the following amino acids has a net negative charge at physiologic pH (~7.4)?
3. Which of the following properties of a protein is least likely to be affected by changes in pH?
4. If a DNA sample contains 18% C on a molar basis. What will be the molar percentage of A, G, and T respectively?

5. Electrophoretic separation at pH 6 of a sample of protein A (M.W 25 kDa) , protein B (M.W  10 kDa) and protein C 3 (M.W 65 kDa) would result in which of the following? (Note: the isoelectric point of each protein occurs at pH 6)

answers.a: Protein A would move the farthest
answers.b: Protein B would move the farthest
answers.c: Protein C would move the farthest
answers.d: None of the protein would move

questions.question: 6. What type of bonds are formed between two amino acids?
7. Which of the following methods can we use to check molecular weight of our protein?
8. In terms of DNA and RNA structure, what is a nucleotide?

answers.a: A nucleotide is a heterocyclic base
answers.b: A nucleotide is a sugar molecule covalently bonded to a heterocyclic base
answers.c: A nucleotide is a sugar molecule bonded to phosphate group/s and a heterocyclic base
answers.d: A nucleotide is a heterocyclic base bonded to phosphate group/s

questions.question: 9. The melting temperature of a nucleic acid:

answers.a: Is directly proportional to the sum of the percentages of adenine and thymine
answers.b: Is directly proportional to the sum of the percentages of adenine and guanine
answers.c: Is directly proportional to the sum of the percentages of thymine and cytosine
answers.d: Is directly proportional to the sum of the percentages of cytosine and guanine

questions.question: 10. Which of the following techniques cannot be used to quantify affinity between an enzyme and its peptide substrate?
